roleset.name: progression over a specific (maybe time) span

roles.note: This sense is also used for stretches of time ('in the long run')

example.name: Example with arg 1
example.text: a decade-long run of unprecedented disasters

example.name: Example with arg 0 as copier
example.text: an initial press run of 100,000 copies

example.name: Example of run as in a length of time
example.text: In the long run,

roleset.note: No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie.

roleset.name: operate or procede

example.name: Example with arg 1 as procede
example.text: prevent [Martin Ackerman]-1 from [*-1] making a run at thecomputer-services concern

example.name: Another arg 1 as procede
example.text: [you]-1 're going [*-1] to make a run of it

example.name: Arg 0 and 1 in the 'operate' sense
example.text: A series of accidents has lead to the end of the Russians' Mir run

roleset.note: Roleset based on run.01-v. No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie.

roleset.name: earn points (on exam/competition)

example.name: Example with scorer
example.text: His run tied the game.

example.name: Baseball example
example.text: Bobby Thomson 's home run

example.name: Another baseball example
example.text: A miracle home run by Kirk Gibson

roleset.note: Roleset based on score.01. Comparison to score.01. No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie.

roleset.name: defect or hole

role.descr: damaged item or location of the run

example.name: arg 1 as location
example.text: a run in the sheets

example.name: Arg 1 as damaged item
example.text: There is a run in my stockings

roleset.note: No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie.

roleset.name: nomlike-run-away

example.name: Example with 'on the run' in a clause, so you can't use arg 0
example.text: After six months on the run, Mr. Chan learned the order for hisarrest had been canceled .

example.name: Watch the trees, if you can annotate an arg 0, do so.
example.text: Steinbaugh, on the run from the police for attempted murder, turned up on Thursday evening.

roleset.note: Roleset based on escape.01. Comparison to escape.01. Verbnet class escape-51.1. Framed by Katie.

roleset.name: run/jog

example.name: Example with arg 0 and direction
example.text: He had to warm up for his run around the block

roleset.note: Roleset based on eventive-nouns-00060. Comparison to run.02-v. Framed by Katie.

roleset.name: Run for office

example.name: Example with both args
example.text: His run for governor

example.name: Another example with both args
example.text: Obama's 2008 presidential run

roleset.note: Roleset based on eventive-nouns-000060. Comparison to run.02-v. No corresponding Verbnet class. Framed by Katie.

roleset.name: mass mad dash to take money out of the banks

example.name: arg1
example.text: Economist Maria Delapasvela , who works with the magazine Rabista Hastion says adopting the US dollar has put an end to Ecuador 's crisis atmosphere characterized by runs on banks and other disruptions .

example.name: both args
example.text: This is only the beginning as depositors have continued their run on the bank even after the bailout.

example.name: Light Verb
example.text: In October 1987, investors made a run on the bank and it had to close its doors.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. No corresponding VNcls.

roleset.name: final round of voting between remaining candidates

role.descr: position candidate will be elected to, subject matter of election

roles.note: If you see an instance with more than one competitor, where each is individually taggable, we should add a role for that. No such examples found so far.

example.name: Args 1 and 2
example.text: No, there isn't going to be a final run-off for President between a female candidate and an African-American candidate.
example.arg: between a female candidate and an African-American candidate

example.name: Args 0 and 1
example.text: The issue came to a head in 1986 when the Democrats ruled too many Republicans had voted in their Run-Off between Bill Baxley and Charlie.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. No corresponding VNcls.

roleset.name: progression (maybe time span) leading up to a deadline

example.name: arg2
example.text: Local elections took place peacefully across Colombia on Sunday despite violence that had marred the run - up to the elections .

example.name: arg1
example.text: For all of this year 's explosive run - up in stock prices , Renaissance Investment Management Inc. 's computer sat on the sidelines .

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. Corresponds to run-n.01, run_up-v.06, VNcls meander-47.7.

roleset.name: encounter

example.name: arg2
example.text: Mr. Blinder said the change was n't related to the brokerage 's recent troubles , which have included sharp declines in earnings , run - ins with the securities regulators and lawsuits by former customers .

example.name: all args
example.text: Cincinnati Bengals wide receiver Jerome Simpson has plead guilty to the charges placed against him for his run-in with the law over marijuana.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. No corresponding VNcls.

roleset.name: explain

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: A quick run down of what has been happening:

roleset.note: Based on Bolt data. Comparison to explain.01. Explain.01 is a member of VN classes indicate-78-1 and transfer_mesg-37.1.1. Framed by Katie.
